Chip wrote:

	<snip/>

>	      However, if A is a subclass of B then I would like a quick way
to say that if B fails then don't run 
>	those tests in A that require a working B, but still run other tests
against A that don't make direct calls >	to B. It would simply make
the error tracing a bit easier and avoid running tests that I know are going

>	to fail.

Nicely said. I could think of many cases where a user would want to state
such a thing, but your example (one I finally used in e-mails that I sent
yesterday but didn't get published yet, odd odd) is a good/clear one. "quick
way to say" is what I am looking for.

I think the trouble with "test run dependency" is that there is an
uncertainty on if the test *will fail* or not, and an uncertainty on if
running the test "helps debug the overall problem by showing more symptoms"
or not. That said, I think a simple/quick/optional way to allow users to
express this lets that be a user choice.

regards,

Adam
